intro: Mallotus monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered mallot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in coastal and sandy environments. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in small inflorescences. It is often found in sandy soils and thrives in coastal areas with high salinity. The plant is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
